pull.title: build, qt: Drop fix_no_printer.patch
pull.body:
The removed patch is not required since [switching](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23489) Qt version from 5.12.11 to 5.15.2.

Upstream bug reports and fixes:
- [QTBUG-62675](https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-62675) fixed in https://github.com/qt/qtbase/commit/b1db1dd655788fb685949959c99c901515bfd8ab since Qt 5.12.5
- [QTBUG-76941](https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-76941) fixed in https://github.com/qt/qtbase/commit/de8bd9ec6b21e3b43b08c4c2588b5116a7ca8ece since Qt 5.12.5

Although the bugs have been fixed since Qt 5.12.5, we did need the patch due to the https://github.com/qt/qtbase/commit/1e5566c2e98098b0f7d7628f62425eec569f3a34 reversal commit which has been introduced in Qt 5.12.7.

build, qt: Drop fix_no_printer.patch

The removed patch is not required since switching Qt version from
5.12.11 to 5.15.2.

events.body:
Due to adjacent modified lines of code, this PR conflicts with #24668. Would it better to combine the former into the latter?

cc @fanquake @prusnak

> Would it better to combine the former into the latter?

I think it's better to rebase this PR on top of https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24668 and keep the PRs separate. No strong preference, though.

issue.title: build, qt: drop fix_no_printer patch, add CVE fixes
issue.body:
- builds on top of https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24668, hence the draft state
- contains fix from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24684
- adds 2 CVE fixes mentioned in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24668

events.body:
I created a new PR https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24688 which contains the commit from this PR + adds CVE fixes mentioned in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24668#issuecomment-1079031717

@hebasto If you agree we can close this PR and focus on reviewing https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24688 once https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24668 is merged in.

> Due to adjacent modified lines of code, this PR conflicts with https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24668. Would it better to combine the former into the latter?

Yes. There's no need for this to be a separate PR. If we're going to bump Qt again, then all these changes should be combined.

issue.title: build, qt: bump Qt5 version to 5.15.3
issue.body:
build, qt: bump Qt5 version to 5.15.3
    
Qt 5.15.3 release is a patch release made on the top of Qt 5.15.2. As a patch
release, Qt 5.15.3 does not add any new functionality but provides bug fixes
and other improvements.
    
https://code.qt.io/cgit/qt/qtreleasenotes.git/about/qt/5.15.3/release-note.md
    
* dropped patches:
  - patches/qt/dont_use_avx_android_x86_64.patch
  - patches/qt/fix_bigsur_style.patch
* adjusted patches:
  - patches/qt/fix_android_jni_static.patch
  - patches/qt/fix_limits_header.patch
  - patches/qt/use_android_ndk23.patch

events.body:
> Yes. There's no need for this to be a separate PR. If we're going to bump Qt again, then all these changes should be combined.

Okay. Cherry-picked the commit from this PR into https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24668

This PR can be closed now.
